qualitative_description: The C++ candidate implements a standard NPZ structure with explicit nutrient uptake, grazing, recycling, mortality and mixing flows. Many functional roles in the TRUTH model are present but some are implemented with different mathematical choices: uptake is multiplicative Michaelis–Menten nutrient limitation times an explicit light saturation (f_I) and a mu_max term, whereas TRUTH used N/(e+N) * a/(b + c P) * P. Grazing is a Holling-type saturating function and matches the TRUTH Holling-III form (generalised by exponent h). Recycling (unassimilated grazing, mortality remineralization, excretion) and a mixing supply to nutrients are present and correspond closely to TRUTH. Differences / extras include explicit temperature (Q10) modifiers on production and loss rates, an explicit irradiance/ light limitation term, and an added quadratic self-limitation term for zooplankton (Z^2) that is not in TRUTH.

nutrient_equation_uptake.matched_form: Michaelis-Menten nutrient uptake with multiplicative light limitation
nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate: f_N = Np/(K_N + Np); mu = mu_max * f_T * f_I * f_N; U = mu * Pp (code lines: "Type f_N = safediv(Np, (K_N + Np), tiny); Type mu = mu_max * f_T * f_I * f_N; Type U = mu * Pp;"). TRUTH used (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+cP))*P — different algebraic form (candidate uses explicit multiplicative nutrient and light saturation rather than TRUTH's P-dependent denominator), so this matches an alternate (Michaelis–Menten × f(I)).

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: Recycling from grazing/mortality/excretion (unassimilated fraction + mortality remineralization + excretion)
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate includes Rg = (1-e_Z)*G, Rp = r_P * m_P_eff * Pp, Rz = r_Z * m_Z_eff * Zp, Ex = ex_Z_eff * Zp and dN includes +Rg +Rp +Rz +Ex (code: "Type Rg = (Type(1.0) - e_Z) * G; Type Rp = r_P * m_P_eff * Pp; Type Rz = r_Z * m_Z_eff * Zp; Type Ex = ex_Z_eff * Zp; dN = -U + Rg + Rp + Rz + Ex + Mx;"). TRUTH has predation-derived recycling and mortality/excretion terms; functional role is equivalent.

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: Candidate: Mx = k_mix * (N_star - Np); included in dN ("Type Mx = k_mix * (N_star - Np); dN = ... + Mx;"). TRUTH uses k*(N0 - N) — same form.

phytoplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: mu * P with multiplicative nutrient and light limitation (Michaelis–Menten × f(I))
phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: growth term U = mu * Pp where mu = mu_max * f_T * f_I * f_N and f_N = Np/(K_N + Np), f_I = I/(K_I + I) ("Type mu = mu_max * f_T * f_I * f_N; Type U = mu * Pp;"). TRUTH uses (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P — different structure (candidate uses explicit I and multiplicative limitation), hence ALTERNATE.

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate: holl_num = pow(Pp + tiny, h_grazing); holl_den = pow(K_G + tiny, h_grazing) + holl_num; g_rate = g_max * f_T * safediv(holl_num, holl_den, tiny); G = g_rate * Zp ("Type g_rate   = g_max * f_T * safediv(holl_num, holl_den, tiny); Type G  = g_rate * Zp;"). TRUTH uses lambda * P^2/(mu^2 + P^2) * Z (Holling-III with h=2). Structure is equivalent (generalised exponent h).

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: linear loss m_P_eff * Pp appears in dP ("Type m_P_eff = m_P * f_T_loss; dP = U - G - m_P_eff * Pp;"). TRUTH includes linear losses r*P and (s+k)*P; the role of linear non-grazing mortality is present and equivalent in form.

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH includes a (s + k)*P mixing/physical loss term in dP; candidate does not include any k_mix*(...) or equivalent linear mixing term acting on P (no Mx applied to P). In the code dP = U - G - m_P_eff * Pp (no mixing).

zooplankton_equation_growth.matched_form: Growth via assimilated grazing: e_Z * G
zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: Zg = e_Z * G and dZ includes +Zg ("Type Zg = e_Z * G; dZ = Zg - m_Z_eff * Zp - gamma_Z_eff * Zp * Zp;"). TRUTH growth is alpha * lambda * P^2/(mu^2+P^2) * Z — same flow (assimilated fraction of ingestion) and structurally equivalent.

zooplankton_equation_mortality.matched_form: Linear mortality (plus extra quadratic density-dependence present)
zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate contains linear loss m_Z_eff * Zp in dZ ("dZ = Zg - m_Z_eff * Zp - gamma_Z_eff * Zp * Zp;"). TRUTH has linear loss q*Z. The linear mortality matches TRUTH; note the candidate also adds a quadratic self-limitation term (gamma_Z_eff * Z^2) which is an extra process but the primary linear mortality matches the TRUTH form.

zooplankton_equation_mixing.matched_form: (no mixing term present in either model)
zooplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH dZ has no explicit mixing/entrainment term; candidate likewise has no mixing term applied to Z (dZ = Zg - m_Z_eff*Zp - gamma_Z_eff*Zp*Zp). Thus absence of a mixing term matches TRUTH.

extra_components_description:
1) Temperature/Q10 modifiers (f_T and f_T_loss): multiplicative scaling of growth/grazing and of loss rates (affects mu, g_rate, and effective mortality/excretion).
2) Explicit irradiance (I) light limitation f_I = I/(K_I + I): an explicit light limitation multiplier on phyto growth (TRUTH had no explicit I).
3) Quadratic zooplankton self-limitation: density-dependent Z^2 loss term via gamma_Z_eff * Zp * Zp in dZ (not present in TRUTH).
